direction.raw_text: - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                    6. 5
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now it's her turn to look impatient. She jerks on the handle again, until he leans over to open the door from the inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry... it sticks. She rolls her eyes, climbs in. 6
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She climbs in, tries to power her window all the way to the top. It keeps getting stuck, leaving a half-inch gap. She shoots him a look: "What the hell?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's as far as it goes.   Sorry. She rolls her eyes, never once interrupting her phone conversation. He puts the car in gear and they set out on their six hour roadtrip. 7
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they drive off, reveal: a forgotten bag of GROCERIES, still sitting on the ground. 8
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They leave campus.   He eavesdrops as she rattles on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you? (listens) No, we're just rolling out... (listens) ... Believe me, I tried, but I couldn't get a flight. It's my own fault for waiting `til the last minute... 9 & 10   OMITTED                                                    9 & 10 WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                  7. 11   INT./EXT. OLDSMOBILE - DUSK                                   11 She looks out at the passing landscape as they cruise south on the interstate. The road is wet, though the snow hasn't yet started to stick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughs; on her cell) What, are you kidding? I'm bored to tears... No, we're still on the highway... how should I know, all highways look exactly alike. She looks up, catches him shooting irritated looks her way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You going to be on that thing the whole- He doesn't finish the thought, just chokes back whatever he was about to say. Focuses on the highway ahead. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                  8. 11    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on her cell) Uh oh, somebody's upset. I better call you back. (pause) Who do you think? Ride Board Guy. Okay, `bye. She hangs up, aims the camera phone lens his way, and snaps another digital picture of him. She puts the cellphone away, looks up to see him glaring at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (blurting) This isn't cool. If I have to drive, you have to talk to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, I'm the in-flight entertainment?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's how this ride-sharing thing works. Division of labor. We split everything fifty-fifty... Get it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got news for you, I don't get much more entertaining than when I'm on the phone. He darkens, mutters under his breath:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sarcastic) This is turning out great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it. They ride in silence for a moment. She tries to strike up a conversation, by way of extending an olive branch. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                  9. 11    CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you're from Wilmington, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where'd you go to school?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (falters for a second) Um... Saint Vitus Academy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: St. Vitus? You're making that up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're acquainted with every school in the area?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty much, yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Including all the Catholic ones? Because that's where I went. Saint Vitus Academy for Catholic Boys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, fine... They drive for a few moments in silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We had a class together, you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Intro to Modern Philosophy. He looks at her expectantly, as if she should remember him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? There were about a million people in that class. It was like Woodstock. Did you ever see so many Eastern religion types? (then) So, what's your major? (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                   10. 11    CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eastern religions. She hoots with laughter. But he's not kidding.   He seems surprised by her response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You aren't majoring in philosophy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I just assumed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would you assume anything about me? We just met.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a little defensive) I don't know... I guess you just... look like a philosophy major.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try engineering. She enjoys the pained look of surprise on his face, lets him twist for a second before explaining:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I only took Philosophy because I need a humanities credit. I heard it was an easy `A.' (then) Hey, that reminds me. What'd you put for the extra credit question on the final?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nietzsche's theory of eternal recurrence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which is basically reincarnation, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, they're not really the same thing. Reincarnation is when you come back as something different and eternal recurrence is when you (MORE) (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                      11. 11    CONTINUED: (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) live the same life over and over again. He looks out at the road, reciting Nietzsche from memory:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The eternal hourglass of existence is turned over and over, and you with it, a grain of dust. She looks at him as if he's nuts.   A beat, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He died of syphilis, you know. He stares grimly at the road ahead, biting back a comment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: High school and philosophy. Pretty much covers everything, don't you think? Guess that concludes the entertainment portion of today's flight. She turns on the radio, finds a station with Christmas music. TITLE CARD ON BLACK:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                    12. 13    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (concentrating) Next gas station you see, do me a favor and pull over. I gotta pee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, I'll keep my eyes peeled. She looks up from her feet, giving him a funny look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (resumes painting) That phrase. `Keeping your eyes peeled.' It's kind of creepy, if you think about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh. Actually, yeah, it is sorta. His eyes linger on her freshly painted toes on the dashboard. She catches him staring.   He blushes, embarrassed.   Says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Speaking of peeling eyeballs. Did you know that's how they do that corrective eye surgery?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They use a laser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, yeah, they do... But there's definitely peeling involved too. I saw it on Discovery Health. If more people knew about the peeling part they might think twice before going under the knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right, laser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm having corrective eye surgery over the break. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                     13. 13    CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. An awkward beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay. I'm not really worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not worried?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're getting it done...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I hate wearing glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But they look good on you. She frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know? I don't wear them outside my dorm. He gets a cornered look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure? You never... to class or anything? Because I could swear I- GIRL Never.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh. Weird. I wonder why I thought- He breaks off, saved by the sight of a gas station up ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, look! Here's your gas station! She looks at him across the dark front seat, suspicious. WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                    14. 14   EXT. PENN-WAY QUICK MART - NIGHT                                14 A florescent oasis in the gathering dark. A tow truck and several old wrecks rusting in the weeds surrounding it. The Oldsmobile pulls off the highway and up to a gas pump. 15   EXT. PENN-WAY QUICK MART - GAS PUMP / OLDSMOBILE - MINUTES      15 LATER He starts the pump.   Notices her still seated in the car. He knocks on her window.    She opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you had to pee?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't expect us to find a bathroom so soon. My nails aren't dry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. He looks over the roof of the car, sizing up the distance across the slushy parking lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well if you want, I can carry you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's okay, they'll be dry in just a second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, I'm good at this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are not carrying me inside. He opens her door, pulls her legs around, and crouches down between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?! Wait - (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                   15. 15    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly he's rising and she throws her arms instinctively around his neck. Unsettling as the deeply-weird moment is, she decides it's best to just humor him. But first -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need my purse. He crouches a little so she can reach to retrieve it. 16   INT. PENN-WAY QUICK MART - NIGHT                                 16 The door JINGLES as he enters, carrying her.   His face is red from effort, hers from embarrassment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. He just stands there.   She taps him on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can let me down now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. He crouches so she can slide off. She gives him a look, slips on the pair of flip-flops she's brought with her, then heads off in search of the ladies bathroom. Meanwhile, our guy saunters up toward the front of the convenience store. He nods to the twitchy CLERK, 20s, engrossed in a tattoo fetish magazine behind the counter. 17   INT. PENN-WAY QUICK MART - BATHROOM - THAT MOMENT                17 The toilet is gross, tiled a queasy green, graffiti-covered. Our girl finishes peeing, gets up from the toilet, uses her foot to flush and her elbow to turn on the faucet. She washes her hands, holding them under the automatic dryer. Broken. She wipes her hands dry on her jeans. Is about to exit when she catches sight of her reflection in the dirty mirror. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                   16. 17    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On impulse she takes out her glasses from her purse.   Slips them on. Checks herself out in the mirror. Cool? Sexy? With her glasses on she notices something scratched into the dirty mirror. CLOSE ON MIRROR Where we see:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HEY, I'M LOCKED IN HERE! Nothing. She turns, scanning the filthy bathroom, notices something. HER POV: A VENT above the sink, near the ceiling. BACK TO SCENE She puts a foot up into the sink, testing it to see if it can take her weight. Then climbs up and straightens on wobbly legs, until her face is near the filthy dust-clogged vent.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: :15 P.M. 12   EXT. INTERSTATE - EVENING                                         12 The Oldsmobile passes slower-moving VEHICLES and zooms by. Its interior light is on. 13   INT. OLDSMOBILE - EVENING                                         13 Her bare feet are propped on the dash, as she removes the old nail polish. Widen. She's turned the front seat into a nail salon. Cotton balls, emery boards, bottles of clear and colored varnish are strewn everywhere. She picks a bottle, opens it, begins painting her nails. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .C.R. 12-24-88 R.I.P." She frowns, slips her glasses back in their case and moves to exit. But when she grips the doorknob she finds it LOCKED. She frowns. Rattles the doorknob a few times. A look of panic crosses her face, and she starts rattling the doorknob harder. Did someone lock her in? Suddenly the doorknob comes off in her hand. She pounds on the door with the heel of her palm, shouts:
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CAN ANYBODY HEAR ME?! HEY! Her voice ECHOES weirdly. When the echoes die down she hears something from the vent that makes her scowl: LAUGHTER. As if our guy and the clerk are having a good laugh at her expense. Pissed off now, she climbs back down, and attacks the broken doorknob with renewed urgency. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                     17. 17    CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 18 As she exits she sees the CLERK and our guy talking quietly, as if they know one another. She hesitates for a second, spying on them around a display of chips. Suspicious. AT THE COUNTER: She strides up as the guy pays for the gas and a couple bottles of water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't you hear me banging in there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (startled; puzzled smile) When?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think it's funny? Me locked in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Locked in where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're telling me you didn't just hear me banging on the door?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what you're-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cuts him off) Forget it. Let's just get on the road. He gathers up the bottled water, heads toward the door.    The clerk calls to him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember, highway's your best bet-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (dismissive) Don't worry about it man, I got it all covered. She frowns, following him to the exit. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                  18. 18    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we lost or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quickly) No, I've made this drive a million times. He holds the door for her, then follows her outside. 19   EXT. PENN-WAY QUICK MART - CONTINUOUS                         19 As they exit and start toward the car she offers him a twenty. He looks at the money, as if he's never seen U.S. currency before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My half of the gas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean? Isn't that how ride-sharing works? -- We split everything fifty-fifty?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't take money from friends. Since when are they friends? They separate, walking around to their respective sides of the car. She tries the passenger door handle, only to find it stuck. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                     19. 19    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She rolls her eyes, waits for him to open it from the inside. 20   OMITTED                                                          20 21   INT. OLDSMOBILE - NIGHT                                          21 She stares out at the road ahead, lulled by the sound of the windshield wipers sweeping snowflakes from side to side. HER POV: A nondescript exit comes up fast for a side road. Which wouldn't be cause for alarm or even interest except- He suddenly turns the wheel sharply, taking the exit. 22   EXT. OLDSMOBILE - THAT MOMENT                                    22 The car veers off the interstate onto a much smaller two-lane road marked with a simple sign, paint-on-wood, faded to illegibility: Scenic Route 606. The tires crunch across an old chain which had once prevented access to the road but is now half-buried in the snow. Attached to it is a diamond-shaped warning sign of a more modern vintage reading: Rough Road. 23   INT. OLDSMOBILE - THAT MOMENT                                    23 She falls against him, bracing herself against the dash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell are you doing!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scenic detour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No way! Get back on the highway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relax, I checked it out on the map. It looks interesting. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                     20. 23    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean it, get back on the highway right now! This is not going to happen! He looks a little pissed she's questioning his judgment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you chill. It's a shortcut. We'll be back on the highway before you know it. Hard to argue with a shortcut... Nonetheless, she glances back with a look of trepidation OUT THE BACK WINDOW at the highway receding into the distance. 24   EXT. SCENIC ROUTE 606 - NIGHT                                    24 The Oldsmobile cruises by, the only car on the two-lane scenic highway. As it leaves FRAME camera PANS to the dead grass on the roadside where it finds a sad little SHRINE half-buried in the snow: two homemade crosses, candle stumps, a rotting stuffed bear, deflated Mylar balloons. Scrawled on the crosses are: Sean            Amanda Dec-24-03        Dec-24-03 25   INT. OLDSMOBILE - NIGHT                                          25 She watches him suspiciously out of the corner of her eye. His face is eerie in the green light of the dashboard. He scans the radio dial for something other than static.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not many radio stations out here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're in a valley. FM radio waves travel in a straight line. They can't penetrate big obstacles like hills. Try AM. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                     21. 25    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where were you when I was flunking freshman physics? He switches over to AM. Finds a low-wattage mountain station broadcasting Bobby Helms' 1957 "Jingle Bell Rock." Then he drives in silence.   Still stewing over her most recent digs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So... Does your family do the whole traditional Christmas thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, my grandparents are Dutch, so I was raised on salted licorice and Sinterklaas...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's that different from the regular Santa Claus?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Instead of the North Pole, he lives in Spain. And instead of elves he's got an enforcer named Black Pete. Basically he's like your Santa, only scarier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your Christmas like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My folks split my freshman year, so I spend the holidays racing between them. Two trees... two turkey dinners...two sets of presents to return for store credit. So normally I can deal, but this year mom decided to rent a condo at the beach. Which is like, what? Two hours away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. The beach can be sort of nice in the winter. Romantic. She gazes out the window at night overtaking the landscape. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                   22. 25    CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So were you a Rehobeth beach family or Stone Harbor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stone Harbor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We always went to Rehobeth. Year in and year out... Jesus, I've never been more bored in my life. I was always so jealous of my friends who spent summers at the Jersey shore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me too. She turns from the window to look at him, scowling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stone Harbor is the Jersey shore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hm? Oh, yeah, I know. What I meant was-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You aren't from Delaware, are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, see, it's kind of complicated-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm exactly who I said I was, am, it's just-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell's going on here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing's going on-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, just calm down. I can explain- (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                    23. 25    CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell? She turns to look ahead, momentarily forgetting their fight as the oncoming headlights cross the median into their lane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think he doesn't see us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can he not? 26   EXT. ROUTE 606 - THAT MOMENT                                    26 From a high angle overlooking the road we watch the two cars racing toward one another, headed on a collision course. 27   INT. OLDSMOBILE - AS BEFORE                                     27 For the time being their fight has taken a back seat to the oncoming car playing chicken with them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull over and let this asshole by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over where? There's no shoulder. He's right. On the passenger side the road abuts a steep wooded hillside. Opposite that it drops off into a ravine. They are both too distracted by the ONCOMING HEADLIGHTS to notice the Christmas SONG that's just come on the RADIO: Brenda Lee's 1958 hit "Rockin' Around the Christmas Tree."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rockin' around, the Christmas tree, at the Christ-mas par-ty hop... 28   EXT. ROUTE 606 - THAT MOMENT                                    28 The distance between the SPEEDING CARS is closing rapidly. 29   INT. OLDSMOBILE - AS BEFORE                                     29 The kids faces go white in the glare of the oncoming lights. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                     24. 29    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mistletoe hung where you can see, Ev'ry couple tries to STOP. Rockin' around, the Christmas tree, have a happy hol-i-day... Later we'll have some pumpkin pie, and do some car- rol-ing... 30   EXT. ROUTE 606 - THAT MOMENT                                     30 The OTHER CAR continues barrelling toward the OLDSMOBILE. The game of chicken fast approaching the point of no return.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will get a sen-ti-men-tal fee- ling when you hear... Voices singing "Let's be jolly, DECK the halls with boughs of holly"... 31   INT. OLDSMOBILE - AS BEFORE                                      31 Relief turns to dread as they realize the other car isn't slowing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not stopping!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on! He jerks the wheel hard, sending the Oldsmobile fishtailing out of control. The OTHER CAR skids over a small bridge and drops out of sight. They spin out in the opposite direction. Skid off the road and SLAM into a snowbank with a bone-shuddering CRASH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rockin' around, the Christmas tree, Have a happy hol-i-day. Everyone's dancing mer-ri-ly in the New. Old. Fash-ioned. Wa-a-ay! TITLE CARD ON BLACK:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                     25. 32   EXT. STRANDED OLDSMOBILE - NIGHT                                 32 The Oldsmobile has ended up on the opposite roadside facing the wrong way, its driver's side jammed into a snowbank. Snow boils in its headlights. 33   INT. STRANDED OLDSMOBILE - NIGHT                                 33 The interior is dark. The girl has been thrown under the dash. It's hard to tell in this light whether she's still breathing. Finally she stirs, disoriented. She climbs back into her seat, piecing together where she is. It takes her a beat to remember him. She looks over slowly. He's not moving, though thanks to his seatbelt he's still upright behind the wheel. His head rests limply against the driver's window, which now looks out on nothing but snowbank. A link of blood trickles down the glass. Dead? She's not taking any chances. Without a sound she slips into her shoes, coat. Gropes for her cellphone among the detritus at her feet. Suddenly he stirs, groaning. She freezes. The seconds ticking by on the DASHBOARD CLOCK. When he doesn't wake, she resumes fumbling for her cell. Finds it.   Then eases open the creaky passenger door. And launches herself into the frigid night. 34   EXT. STRANDED OLDSMOBILE / ROADSIDE - NIGHT                      34 She hurries down the road away from the car. Breath clouding in the frigid air. Punches in numbers on her cell phone. INSERT CELLPHONE SCREEN -- (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                    26. 34    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No SIGNAL BARS. She's starting to freak now.   She hits the REDIAL button.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... please... please... please... Suddenly, from behind -- GUY (O.S.) What are you doing? She screams, spins around. He's standing right behind her, his face in silhouette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C-Calling 9-1-1. Or trying to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any luck?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shakes head `no') Can't... I can't get a signal here. He receives this news with a strange calm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about yours?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have a cell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can you not have a cell?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (ignoring her) How're you doing? You all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... yeah, I'm okay. Nothing broken... What about you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Think I hit my head. He puts his hand to the left side of his skull and pushes on it. Like someone testing a melon for ripeness. Come to think of it, his speech is a little wooden. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                     27. 34    CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to the, uh, the guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Asshole who ran us off the road. She's completely forgotten all about the other vehicle until now. She turns to look, puzzled. There's no sign of the other vehicle anywhere. They're alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I guess maybe he decided just to hit and run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So where are his tire tracks? She looks, sees an unbroken expanse of fresh white snow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In case you haven't noticed, it's coming down pretty hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (points) Yeah, but you can still see our tracks. The mystery of the missing tracks seems to have penetrated his post-accident fog, bringing him back into sharper focus. She watches as he walks out in front of the Olds' headlights to the middle of the road, where the other vehicles track's should be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell?! He walks back to the Olds and opens the passenger door (the only access into or out of the stranded car, thanks to the snowbank). He begins searching the glove compartment for a flashlight. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                     28. 34    CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This doesn't make any sense... At that moment he emerges from the car with a flashlight. He spokes it, sweeps the strong beam over their surroundings. The left side of the road falls off into a darkness so deep even the flashlight's beam can't penetrate it. A precipice. He cups his hand and calls out at the top of his lungs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! She jumps at the sound of his voice, her nerves frazzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !? ANYONE?! HEY! His voice is swallowed by the dark. After the echoes subside the only sound in the hush is the SIZZLE of falling snow and a weird otherworldly HUM. He snaps off his flashlight, thrusts it into his coat pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What now? (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                     29. 34    CONTINUED: (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess we see how bad we're stuck. They trudge back to the car, boots crunching in the snow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You steer, I'll push. He holds the passenger door for her while she scrambles in, scooting over into the driver's seat. He leaves the door open so they can communicate. He walks back to the rear of the stranded Oldsmobile. He's pulling on gloves when something half-buried in the snow nearby catches his eye. He takes out the flashlight, shines it at the roadside. Little wooden crosses. Just two this time. Another sad shrine, to a different set of anonymous victims of Route 606. Their proximity to the stranded Olds obviously unsettles him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calling) Ready? He bends with a little wince and braces his shoulder against the rear bumper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calling) Ready! The tail lights come on as she turns the ignition.   He hears her crank the starter motor. Cranking... cranking... cranking... Finally turning over. She slips the Oldsmobile in gear, and he starts pushing. The rear tires spin, throwing slush; but car won't budge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calling) Give it more gas! She floors it; the tires SCREAMING. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                      30. 34    CONTINUED: (5)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts everything he's got into pushing, but it's no use. Suddenly his face contorts in pain and he clutches his side. He drops out of view, disappearing in a cloud of red exhaust. A beat later he pulls himself up, pounds on the trunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop! The tires stop spinning. 35   INT. STRANDED OLDSMOBILE - NIGHT                                  35 She's sitting in the driver's seat of the idling car when she hears the crunch-crunch-crunch of his approaching footsteps. In that moment she makes a decision. Scrambles across the front seat, pulls the door shut hard. 36   INT./EXT. STRANDED OLDSMOBILE - THAT MOMENT                       36 He arrives at the passenger side door handle just as the power locks all go THUNK. He's locked out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, open up. He tugs at the handle a few times.      Knocks on the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna pop the locks? When there's no response from her he puts his lips to the half-inch gap at the top of the stuck window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gonna unlock the door or what? She sees him cup his hands and peering in through the window. She keeps her eyes down, focuses on her shaking fingers as they frantically dial her cellphone. No signal. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                  31. 36    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Hey, c'mon, it's freezing out here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better get used to it, asshole. He rattles the door handle, starting to get panicked now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell is wrong with you? What did I do? But she's in full-blown paranoid mode now, near hysterics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You drove us here, that's what you did!! What the hell did you think you were doing!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought I was driving you home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not driving me home because one, you don't live near my home and two, this piece of shit isn't driving anywhere. Now what are we doing here? Why did you get off the highway?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you, this is a shortcut. Anyway, you were the one who said she was so bored on the highway. This used to be called `Scenic 606' because there's an amazing view of the valley-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One, you've never been anywhere near here before so don't pretend you knew it's a shortcut, and two, there's an amazing view of shit
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: And finally succeeds in getting the door to open. 18   INT. PENN-WAY QUICK MART - OUTSIDE BATHROOM - CONTINUOUS
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: GIRL WHAT THE HELL IS GOING ON HERE

dialogue.raw_text: suddenly appear up ahead, blindingly bright.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She watches as he turns and takes a few aimless steps away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Deliberating whether to seize this moment of distraction to make a break for it. She looks back down the long dark road. Looks back at him bent over rummaging in the Oldsmobile. Too risky. Curiosity getting the better of her, she walks out to the middle of the road to have a look for herself. No tracks. Just an expanse of fresh powder and a few of his footprints.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ! He stands there as she freaks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me get this straight. You think I intentionally arranged for us get stranded out here?! It was an (MORE) (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                  32. 36    CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: accident! You saw the other car. You think he was in on it, too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (raving) Maybe! Maybe he's like your Black Pete or something! Why the hell did you tell me that story anyway?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're crazy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (lying) Anyway, I've got news for you... I got through to a friend's voicemail while you were supposedly unconscious. I'm sure she's called the cops by now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you listen to yourself? What kind of psycho do you think I am?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. He straightens, exasperated, puts a hand to his injured head. She looks at him standing there, hugging himself against the sub-zero cold, his teeth chattering. He doesn't look like an ax-murderer. She doesn't know what to do. There's a long beat. Finally, he throws up his hands in disgust, decides to go to Plan B.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna walk back to the gas station for help. You've got the heater and the radio, so you should be all right here. Though I really think you should consider coming with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet you do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pissed) Fine. Whatever. If you feel a draft and you want to patch this... (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                     33. 36    CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I keep duct tape in the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet you do. He looks in at her one last time, exits. She listens to the crunch of his footsteps until she can't hear them anymore. Suddenly there's a loud BANG against the passenger side window. She jumps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !! He goes crazy on the stranded Olds: punching the roof, jerking the door handle, kicking the door, screaming at her the whole time. She cowers inside, scared to death. Finally he gives up, and with a final BANG to the roof, exits. He turns and heads back down the road. We watch through the rear window as he trudges robotically away, his boots crunch-crunch-crunching in the snow. He stops.   Leans his weight against a tree.    Looks back at the car. Whatever it is he's doing, he's clearly not walking to the gas station. He straightens, and continues on until he's out of sight. 37   EXT. STRANDED OLDSMOBILE / ROADSIDE - NIGHT                      37 The stranded Oldsmobile sits on the roadside, engine running, hood and windshield covered in white. The interior lights are on, giving it an enchanted look, like a cottage in a Grimm's fairytale. WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                    34. 38   INT. STRANDED OLDSMOBILE - NIGHT                                38 She's in the back seat ransacking his suitcase and other possessions, looking for the duct tape. Despite the heater it's cold enough in the car (thanks to the gap in the window) to see her breath. A PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENT plays on the car's radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... The National Weather Service has issued a Winter Storm Warning for the entire Eastern Seaboard... Boxer shorts. Socks. Box of condoms. A copy of the Tibetan Book of the Dead. A cheap Radio Shack TELEPHONE wrapped in its cord. A CROW BAR, which she tosses up to the front seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Carbon County residents can expect snow accumulations of four to six inches... Suddenly we see - A BLUR OF MOVEMENT outside the car's foggy REAR WINDOW... But she's too busy searching through the junk in the back seat to notice. Finally she finds what she's looking for: silver DUCT TAPE. Also a PAIR OF SCISSORS. She holds the scissors like a dagger, clearly thinking they could come in useful if she needs to defend herself. She climbs up front, rips off a three-foot length of tape. Again, in the b.g. - MORE MOVEMENT outside the car... But she's too busy sealing the passenger's side window against the frigid draft to notice that someone's outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... State and local officials are urging residents to remain indoors, (MORE) (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                    35. 38    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) as wind chills plunge to fifteen below overnight... Finally - She glimpses MOVEMENT outside the passenger window. She gasps, ducking out of sight below the car's dashboard. She doesn't move, listening, her eyes bright with fear. After a long beat she risks a peek over the steering wheel. The windshield is fogged, so she wipes a peephole in the condensate. It's too dark to see much beyond the car's hood. She reaches shaking fingers toward the steering column. Flicks on the headlights. A STRANGER is walking away down the middle of the dark road. She screams, reaches instinctively to check the power locks. The stranger, a black man dressed in a dirty suit, walks with hunched shoulders. Snow swirling around him in the darkness. Who the hell takes a stroll in the middle of a snowstorm? Over her initial shock now, she reaches for the door handle. 39   EXT. ROUTE 606 - ROADSIDE - NIGHT                               39 She gets out of the car, clutching the SCISSORS in both hands like a dagger. She stands behind the protection of the open car door and calls out to the stranger moving down the middle of the snowy road a dozen yards ahead. There's a weird HUMMING noise in the air she can't place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! No reaction from the stranger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? Do you live around here? Again, nothing.    Maybe he's deaf? She moves out from behind the safety of the car door and starts after the stranger, keeping her distance as she calls: (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                    36. 39    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) We had an accident. My friend went for help. He'll be back any second. The stranger's dapper suit is more than dishevelled. It's soaking wet, caked in motor oil or some other dark slime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kinda crappy night for a walk, don't you think? And there's something definitely "off about his shuffling. It's like he's crippled, or injured. In fact he seems to be CRYING. (Or is it moaning?)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, wait! But the stranger just keeps shuffling toward the shoulder of the road, headed in the direction of the DARK STAND OF TREES beyond. Soon he moves beyond the reach of the headlights and disappears into the gloom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell - !? Spooked, she begins to back toward the stranded Oldsmobile. Backs into -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. She SCREAMS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus! Calm down. It's just me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay away from me! She brandishes the SCISSORS.    He puts up two hands defensively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa! Take it easy. What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You! Everything! The guy-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What guy? (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                     37. 39    CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, it was weird. I saw some guy walking down the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where did he go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Into the woods. Her eyes keep cutting back and forth between him and the woods where the stranger disappeared, as if not sure which is the greater threat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look. It's freezing out here. Let's just get in the car and you can tell me what happened...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (paranoid) What are you doing back so soon? What about hiking to the gas station?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was closed. I was going to leave a note, but I didn't... You know. Have anything to write with. She clutches the scissors tighter, not believing a word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But those places are supposed to stay open 24/7! Why wasn't it open?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How the hell should I know?! Independent operator. Look, can we continue this conversation in the car, `cause I'm freezing my balls off standing out here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shrieks) I'm not getting into the car with you, you psycho!!! He closes his eyes and shakes his head, beyond frustrated. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                     38. 39    CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine. Whatever. I'm getting in. You're welcome to join me. He turns and trudges back to the Oldsmobile, climbs in, and pulls the door shut after him. Leaving her there in the snowy road, clutching the scissors, her teeth chattering. She stands there, shivering, looking very small and alone. HOLD on her as she weighs her options: stay out here and freeze. Or risk seeking shelter with a stalker. Not much of a choice. 40   INT. STRANDED OLDSMOBILE - MOMENTS LATER                         40 He looks over as the door wrenches open and she climbs in. She pulls the door shut behind her, then huddles against it. Eyeing him warily. He starts to reach toward her and she brandishes the scissors-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relax. - and switches off the overhead interior lights, explaining:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to conserve the battery. With the interior light off the car fills with an otherwordly blue glow reflected off the snow. She pulls her knees up as if trying to make herself as small as she can, to position herself as far away from him as is humanly possible on a bench seat. Her eyes cut to the DASHBOARD CLOCK.    She frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not right. The clock...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (checks watch) Huh? No, it's not. It should read... He frowns, looking down at his watch.    He holds it to his ear. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                  39. 40    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) My watch stopped. Oh well... Guess we'll just have to rely on my precisely calibrated body clock. He tosses his useless watch over his shoulder into the back seat. Suddenly she notices a trickle of blood coming from his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're bleeding. He touches two fingers to the left side of his head. They come away bloody. As he lifts his watch cap we see the left side of his head is matted with frozen blood, now beginning to melt. The collar of his coat is soaked with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's nothing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't look like nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scalp wounds bleed a lot. Head wounds in general. That's why, if you're ever in a bar fight, the thing to do is pick up a bottle and smash the other guy across the bridge of his nose. It'll make his eyes fill with blood and snot, and buy you enough time to run away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softening, amused) That's really useful, thanks. A tense silence fills the car. He closes his eyes and leans his head back, as if trying to catch a few Z's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So where are you from, really? (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                  40. 40    CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (eyes closed) Place called Glens Falls...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not in Delaware.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's, like, in the complete opposite direction!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's like twenty minutes from school!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, all right, so I lied... Obviously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? Eyes still closed, he answers in a flat uninflected voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just thought you seemed cool. I don't have a line or a `game' or whatever the hell it's called. So when I saw a chance to get you alone for six uninterrupted hours, I took it. She ponders this for a beat, one piece still not clicking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But how did you know where I lived?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Asked around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which explains how you found out I was from Delaware... But not how you knew I needed a ride home. I mean, I always fly. How could you possibly know that for, like the (MORE) (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                  40A. 40    CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: first time in my college career, I was planning on going Greyhound- Just then her eyes go wide, as it suddenly dawns on her. WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                      41. 41   FLASHBACK:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: revisits events from earlier that day. - The text message, "y don't u check the ride board?" - Her looking up, smiling. - Sitting behind her, reading the message:    OUR GUY. - Who bolts from his seat the instant class is dismissed. - Who turns out to be the one who jostled her on his way out. - He races across the empty quad, scribbling on the run. - Tears the improvised notice out of his spiral notebook. - Slaps it up on the RIDE BOARD just in the nick of time. - As she enters and sees: "NE1 Need a ride 2 Delaware 12/23?" FLASHBACK ENDS: 42   INT. STRANDED OLDSMOBILE - AS BEFORE                              42 She looks at him, the pieces all finally falling into place. He makes no effort to explain. Doesn't even open his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forgive me for attempting a romantic gesture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Romantic? Try stalkerish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not if things worked out between us...I would've told you everything eventually, and then it wouldn't be stalkerish. It would just be this sweet funny story we'd have.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We?! He sits up sharply, temper boiling over, glaring at her. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                    42. 42    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, you've made your point! I'm a creep who gets off on chauffeuring women under false pretenses. Can we drop this already? (changing subject) Christ. I'm starving. You hungry? He leans over the seatback, begins rummaging in the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you see a bag of groceries in the trunk? At mention of groceries she temporarily drops the topic of the gas station. Remembers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Oh, shit. I think I might've left it in the parking lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. It was an accident-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit! I spent sixty bucks on this gourmet crap you like! Saint Andre's cheese and Carr's crackers and those stupid little French pickles, I forget what they're called-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quietly) Cornichons... I love cornichons. He sighs, slumps back behind the steering wheel, defeated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. 43   EXT. ROUTE 606 - ROADSIDE - NIGHT                                43 The wind blows.    In between gusts it's quiet, except for the strange HUM. WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                     43. 44   INT. STRANDED OLDSMOBILE - NIGHT                                 44 She's still huddled up front, still holding her scissors. He's in the back seat, scouring the car for anything edible, scrounging Tic Tacs, stale pretzel nibs, a candy bar, etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I remember losing pack of Big Red down the back seat cushions last week... He thrusts his hand between the seat cushions like a scuba diver feeling for lobster under a coral reef. DOWN THE BACK SEAT: His hand fumbles in the dark space below the seat cushions, among the seatbelts, lost nickels and dimes, lint. BACK TO SCENE Suddenly his eyes go wide as something lurking under the seats seizes his hand and jerks him in hard. She GASPS. His face contorts in agony. Then changes to a smile, as he pulls his hand free, unhurt, holding a stick of gum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kidding. She looks at him in mute fury and disbelief. He shrugs, unwraps a stick of Big Red and pops it into his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Asshole. Suddenly his hand shoots out and seizes her wrist holding the scissors. Her eyes go wide in terror and she starts to resist, but his grip is too strong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let go, goddamnit... (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                  44. 44    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give them to me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!!! With his free hand he reaches over and wrenches the scissors away from her, his eyes flashing. She gives a little terrified whimper as he pulls her close, brandishes the scissors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need these. 45   INT. STRANDED OLDSMOBILE - LATER                               45 With the blade of the open scissors he divides a stale candy bar, divvying it up. He closes the scissors. Serves up the two halves of candy bar on napkins with a side of stale pretzel nibs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I still can't believe you left all our food in a stupid parking lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I'm sorry, okay? I'll write you a check for sixty bucks if it will make you get off my case. I don't know what else I can say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's just eat. They eat in silence, each chewing the unappetizing "dinner."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to himself) Story of my life. Never fails...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You. Girls. Women. You seem cool at first. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                     45. 45    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should all come with a warning, like car mirrors: "Objects in belly shirts are flakier than they appear."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to talk about fake? How about guys who pretend to be from Delaware to meet girls?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about we just stop talking altogether.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's perfect. Because now that I'm not some Nietzche-spouting sexbot, suddenly I'm not worth knowing. And who's fault is that? He doesn't answer, only withdraws into himself, sulking. All of a sudden the Oldsmobile gives a SHUDDER. And then the engine DIES. 46   EXT. STRANDED OLDSMOBILE / ROADSIDE - NIGHT                      46 They leap out to investigate, dropping down on all fours to shine the flashlight under the chassis. HER POV: Under the car. The beam illuminates a yellow crater of melted snow beneath the car's undercarriage. BACK TO SCENE She reaches under to scoop up some of the yellow snow. Retrieves it so she can hold it under her nose and sniff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well? (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                       46. 46    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuel tank must've been ruptured in the accident.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you fix it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not unless you have a welding rig in all that shit of yours. And even if you did, it wouldn't matter. We're out of gas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we still have the battery, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As long as we use it sparingly, it should last the night. Question is, will we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean? She gives him a sober look, as the storm rages around them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No engine... no heat. He looks at her, a look of grim determination on his face. He marches to the car, pops the trunk. Retrieves her suitcase. 47   INT. STRANDED OLDSMOBILE - NIGHT                                   47 He dumps her suitcase in front.    She climbs in after it. Slams the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Layers... He rolls into the back, fishes his suitcase out of the mess. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                      47. 47    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Only thing that's gonna get us to sun-up. So put aside fashion sense and start layering everything you brought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I didn't bring anything. He raises an eyebrow, leans over the front seat to unzip her suitcase and see for himself. Christmas gifts, skimpy tees, panties and bras, a bikini.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, Jesus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (defensive) I'm sorry, but who could prepare for something like this?! I've got a complete winter wardrobe, it's just in Delaware... And no, that doesn't make me a flake! He unzips his suitcase.      Starts pulling out Ragg socks, long- sleeve pullovers, etc. He shoves a ball of clothes into her hands without a word. 48   OMITTED                                                             48 49   INT. STRANDED OLDSMOBILE - NIGHT                                    49 The kids have retreated to the front- and back seats for privacy while they change. Not an easy proposition in the cramped quarters. She strips down to bra and panties as demurely as possible. Puts on his insulated underwear and the rest of their things. He slips on his woefully inadequate shirts and pants. It's obvious he gave the warmest stuff to her. Also that he took the backseat because it's more cramped than the front. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                    48. 49    CONTINUED:

direction.raw_text: Once they're finished dressing he reaches up, switches off the interior light. They lie in the blue darkness for a few moments of silence, watching their breath plume in the cold air. [Note: from this point on, their breath will always be visible in the car.] He hears her sigh, restless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm freezing. I can't feel my toes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me neither. Nothing much they can do about it.   They fall silent again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, there is a better way for two people to conserve body heat-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dream on. But we see her smiling a little in the dark front seat. They lie in silence for another beat as she tries every position possible to get comfortable. Finally she sits up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gotta pee. She starts to climb over into the cramped front seat, intending to go outside. He winces when she puts a hand on his chest to steady herself as she climbs over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (testy) Why didn't you go before, when we were outside?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because it's freezing out. We're talking about an arctic air mass out of Canada. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                     49. 49    CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's still freezing out-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but now I've got to go. Promise not to look. She pops the door and exits. 50   EXT. STRANDED OLDSMOBILE / ROADSIDE - NIGHT                      50 She climbs out into the bitter cold, hunched against the howling wind, and moves off as far as she dares from the car. She fumbles with the buttons and zippers of her multiple layers, turns her back to the car, squats to pee. Her teeth chatter as she does her business, one wary eye peeled to catch the guy peeking. Suddenly, out of the gloom appears - A DARK FIGURE, moving by very near her. She GASPS. Tumbles back onto her ass.     As she's struggling to pull up her pants - MORE DARK FIGURES appear, moving in the same direction. As the figures enter the woods their leader turns so she glimpses his face: elderly and unremarkable at first glance, then for an instant CHANGING into a twisted ashen deathmask. Her SCREAM brings our guy BOLTING out of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?! What happened?! But it all happened so fast she doesn't believe her eyes. She gestures at the procession of DARK FIGURES disappearing ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (still in shock) - Did you see? - They were right here! -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you stop them?! Maybe they have a phone! (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                     50. 50    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our guy ducks back into the car, retrieves a flashlight from the glove compartment. He eases the door shut, carefully so it doesn't latch and accidentally lock them out. The he starts off running after the figures. Scared as she is, she decides to follow rather than remain at the car by herself. 51   EXT. ROUTE 606 - FURTHER DOWN ROAD / TOP OF A RAVINE - NIGHT 51 The two kids arrive at the place on the road -- top of a ravine disappearing thirty feet below -- where the dark figures seemed to be headed. Only to find NO ONE THERE.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Wait! We need help here! Climbing down into the ravine seems too treacherous, so the kids are forced to backtrack to a place several yards away where they can follow the DARK FIGURES into the: 52   EXT. WOODS - NIGHT                                               52 They follow the bobbing beam of the flashlight through the trees, in pursuit of the OLD MAN in black coat and fedora. Our guy falls behind, winded. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                      51. 52    CONTINUED:

direction.raw_text: Gotta - just a sec - catch my -

direction.raw_text: (reluctantly) Okay. She trudges on ahead, her footsteps growing FAINTER, finally fading entirely. He's alone now. He leans against a tree to catch his breath, wincing in pain. For an instant it seems like he's going to be sick. But then he just hocks up phlegm and spits into the pure white snow. Blood. Though still winded, he pushes on. 53   EXT. HILLTOP - NIGHT                                              53 A few minutes later he trudges into view.   Looks around.    No sign of our girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? Hello? He arrives at the top of the hill.   Silhouetted against the night sky. Treeless. His flashlight finds the few vertical objects still standing. A RUINED BUILDING Windowless and long-abandoned, its ceiling and walls caved in around a large stone chimney. He crunches inside and examines the black maw of the large stone fireplace, now stuffed with trash and dead leaves. His flashlight beam finds a SMALL IRON DOOR built into the side of the chimney. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                     52. 53    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He kneels in the snow and tugs the little iron door open. Gingerly slips his arm inside the firebox. Retrieves a bunch of OLD NEWSPAPERS. He stuffs them inside the front of his jacket. Continues rummaging around in the firebox. As he rises he winces in pain, one hand going to his side. He takes slow breaths until the pain subsides. He turns in a slow circle. His flashlight sweeps over the interior of the abandoned ruins, the beam picking out what look like branches - HUMAN HANDS frozen into claws, reaching from... A FROZEN BODY. It's lying on the bare springs of a metal bedframe: teeth clenched in a terrible rictus, icicles dripping from nose, clawlike fingers, eyes. He's so startled he nearly drops the flashlight. The wayward light finding ANOTHER FROZEN CORPSE in a nearby bed mere feet away: another rictus grimace, clawlike fingers seeming to reach for him. And then another. And another... All OLD MEN. Frozen in their death throes, like the bodies from Pompeii. ONE OF THE BEDS is EMPTY. Our guy sweeps the flashlight beam to the side and finds the bed's occupant: frozen sitting upright in an old wooden wheelchair. Eye to eye with him. He reels in horror, trips, LOSES THE FLASHLIGHT as he goes sprawling. Then recovers, snatching the flashlight up again and sweeping it back in the direction of the frozen bodies - And sees NOTHING:   No beds.   No old men... (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                    52A. 53    CONTINUED: (2)

direction.raw_text: 54 Our girl emerges from the trees, having decided to give up the chase and return to the safety of the car. Just as she's reaching for the door handle she GASPS - As a FIGURE suddenly appears out of the darkness. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                     53. 54    CONTINUED:

direction.raw_text: It's the black STRANGER from earlier, shuffling and mumbling. This time he's close enough for her to make out some of the words he's muttering:

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...please, officer, just take the booze and let me go... She reaches toward him. The instant her hand nears him the wind HOWLS DEAFENINGLY. She experiences a sudden powerful JOLT, almost as if she's grabbed a live wire... only instead of electric heat she feels a terrible otherwordly cold... Frostbite. The jolt stuns the stranger out of his daze, and for the first time he becomes aware of her. He raises his frightened eyes to her slowly, and in doing so reveals his face. A scream builds in her throat at sight of him. The stranger's face is bloodless, bloated, swollen with rot. A sludgy gargling noise comes from his throat and his mouth moves, as if he's trying to speak. But instead of words emerging, his throat suddenly bulges. Something's in there, fighting its way up his esophagus. (CONTINUED) WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                   54. 54    CONTINUED: (2)
